answers.answer: HI,I do agree you should have a further check into those concerns.Medications can cause some changes in blood counts etc but do not often cause an enlarged spleen.I am afraid I am not the best person for this situation--a Hematologist is  really the best qualified person regarding those concerns and questions, so I encourage you to seek consultation with one as soon as you can.Take care.

question: I have Type II diabetes.  I am on Metformin and Diamicron.  I always feel sleepy and my stomach feels full.  I was told my spleen was enlarged and my blood was low, especially my platelets are very low, below 100,000 and my white and red cells are below normal.Could I have cancer in my blood or might I be having a reaction to the drugs I am taking?  I am not getting any answers and getting very worried.  I tried to do a bone marrow test but it wasn't effective and didn't give me any answers.  Can you recommend any more tests?
title: Could it be lukemia or myeloma?
